hints.title: Frame Independence of the Fractal Set
hints.content:
599: :label: prop-frame-independence
600: 
601: Let $\mathcal{F} = (\mathcal{N}, E_{\text{CST}} \cup E_{\text{IG}})$ be the Fractal Set. Under a coordinate transformation $x \mapsto x' = R(x)$ with $R \in \text{SO}(d)$:
602: 
603: 1. **Node scalars** are invariant:
604:    $$
605:    \Phi'(n) = \Phi(n), \quad E'_{\text{kin}}(n) = E_{\text{kin}}(n), \quad \text{etc.}
606:    $$
607: 
608: 2. **Edge spinors** transform covariantly:
609:    $$
610:    \psi'_v = S(R) \psi_v, \quad \psi'_{\mathbf{F}} = S(R) \psi_{\mathbf{F}}, \quad \text{etc.}
611:    $$
612: 
613:    where $S: \text{SO}(d) \to \text{Spin}(d)$ is the spinor representation.
614: 
615: 3. **Physical observables** (derived from spinors) are invariant:
616:    $$
617:    \|\mathbf{F}_{\text{total}}\|' = \|\mathbf{F}_{\text{total}}\|, \quad \theta'_{\text{deflection}} = \theta_{\text{deflection}}
618:    $$
